metdetection.utils

Class SmoothingUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • metdetection.utils.SmoothingUtils

  • public class SmoothingUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A static class of some static utility functions that perform Good-Turing smoothing as in Church et al (1991).
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 25 March, 2016

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private SmoothingUtils()
      A private constructor since this class should never be instantiated.

      Get the frequency count estimate of the given frequency based on the values from the regression from a log-log plot.

      Get the frequency counts of the counts in the given Collection.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • getGoodTuringSmoothing

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> getGoodTuringSmoothing(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> frequencyCounts,
                                                                       int count)
        Return the Good-Turing smoothed probability values for our counts.
        Parameters:
        frequencyCounts - A Map of the frequency of an object to the number of objects with that frequency.
        count - The total count of all objects.
        Returns:
        A Map of the Good-Turing smoothed probability values for each frequency.

      • getFrequencyCountEstimate

        private static double getFrequencyCountEstimate(double[] regression,
                               int frequency)
        Get the frequency count estimate of the given frequency based on the values from the regression from a log-log plot.
        Parameters:
        regression - The slope (index 0) and intercept (index 1) of the regression line (from a log-log plot).
        frequency - The frequency whose count we want.
        Returns:
        The count of the given frequency from the regression line.

      • linearRegression

        private static double[] linearRegression(double[] x,
                        double[] y)
        Perform linear regression given x and y coordinates.
        This algorithm was adapted from http://introcs.cs.princeton.edu/java/97data/LinearRegression.java.html
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinates of our points.
        y - The y coordinates of our points.
        Returns:
        A length 2 array containing the slope at index 0 and the intercept at index 1.

      • removeFrequency

        public static void removeFrequency(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> frequencyCounts,
                   int frequency)
        Remove one count from the given frequency in the given Map.
        Parameters:
        frequencyCounts - A Map of the frequency of an object to the number of objects with that frequency. We will decrement 1 from this Map.
        frequency - The frequency whose count we want to decrement.

      • addFrequency

        public static void addFrequency(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> frequencyCounts,
                int frequency)
        Add one to the count of the given frequency in the given Map.
        Parameters:
        frequencyCounts - A Map of the frequency of an object to the number of objects with that frequency. We will increment one in this Map.
        frequency - The frequency whose count we want to increment.

      • getFrequencyMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getFrequencyMap(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> counts)
        Get the frequency counts of the counts in the given Collection.
        Parameters:
        counts - The Collection whose frequency counts we want.
        Returns:
        A Map of a count to the frequency of that count in the given Collection.

      • getTotalCount

        public static int getTotalCount(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> counts)
        Get the sum of the counts in the given collection.
        Parameters:
        counts - A Collection of counts which we want to sum.
        Returns:
        A sum of the counts in the given Collection.
